Response:
{"embed":{"title":"","description":"- Do not ask leading questions (i.e. "Does anyone have an issue with PMM?"), be precise with what it is you need support with.


- If you have a problem, explain it as clearly as possible.


- If you have already tried to resolve an issue, explain what you have tried to do so far and what the outcome was.


- Assume that the person responding to you does not know what your setup involves, try to give detail of your setup (operating system, PMM branch and version, docker or local, etc.)


- Try to avoid the X-Y Problem (https://xyproblem.info/) by clearly explaining the root issue you are facing, rather than asking about a solution that you have already landed on.","color":4321431,"url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Asking Questions Effectively","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":"https://media.tenor.com/qBKkuAE5hyQAAAAC/bart-simpson-at-least-you-tried.gif"},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"In some circumstances [typically NAS], it can be difficult to run PMM in the interactive mode required for authenticating against MyAnimeList and Trakt.

chazlarson has a scripts that can do this authentication outside of PMM in [his repo](https://github.com/chazlarson/Media-Scripts), but that requires you to be able to run a Python script on your computer or NAS, which may not be possible for whatever reason.

You can run those scripts online [on any OS] here:
<https://replit.com/@chazlarson/MALAuth> 
<https://replit.com/@chazlarson/TraktAuth> 

Click the green play button, wait a little bit, then follow the prompts.","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Online Auth scripts","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"Use [Plex Image Cleanup](https://metamanager.wiki/en/nightly/home/scripts/image-cleanup.html) to get rid of unwanted bloat!

Features include:
:one: Cleaning up of custom posters and title cards that were uploaded to Plex and are not in use anymore
:two: Deleting the Phototranscoder folder to free up even more space
:three: Perform the `Empty Trash`, `Clean Bundles` and `Optimize DB` operations
:four: Scheduling Plex Image Cleanup to run regularly","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Worried about Image Bloat?","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":"https://media.tenor.com/EWZCUGkCcIsAAAAC/old-man-my-computer.gif"},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"NOTE: This is addressing changing from, for instance, `latest` to `nightly`.

The method depends on how you installed it.

","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Moving between branches of PMM","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[{"name":"**I'M USING DOCKER:**","value":"```
docker pull meisnate12/plex-meta-manager:TAG_HERE
```
replace `TAG_HERE` with `latest`, `develop`, or `nightly`; whichever you want to switch *to*.

Then recreate your container via whatever means you used to create it  [`docker run`, `docker-compose`, etc.], setting the image as `meisnate12/plex-meta-manager:TAG_HERE`

","inline":false},{"name":"**I'M USING DOCKER ON UNRAID** ","value":":one: Click on DOCKER tab and then on Plex-Meta-Manager
:two: Edit `Repository:` setting to switch branches: 

`meisnate12/plex-meta-manager:TAG_HERE`

replace `TAG_HERE` with `latest`, `develop`, or `nightly`; whichever you want to switch *to*.

","inline":false},{"name":"**I'M USING DOCKER ON A SYSTEM WITHOUT COMMAND PROMPT (SUCH AS NAS):**","value":"The same concepts as above will apply:
:one: pull new image
:two: recreate container using that image instead of the current one.

Whatever the system, there will be a way to accomplish these two things.

","inline":false},{"name":"**I'M RUNNING LOCALLY VIA GIT:**","value":"```
cd DIRECTORY_WHERE_YOU_PUT_PMM
git checkout BRANCH_NAME
git stash
git stash clear
git pull
```
For BRANCH_NAME, substitute `master`, `develop`, or `nightly`

Those `stash` commands are going to discard any changes you may have made to PMM's own files.  If that's a concern, you are probably familiar enough with `git` to know what you need to do instead.","inline":false}]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"Need some moderately cool scripts? Check out bullmoose20's repo at: https://github.com/bullmoose20/Plex-Stuff#scripts 
Scripts:

:one: `plex-bloat-fix.py` - removes unneeded image files (Posters/Title Cards) from plex

:two: `plexdance.sh` - Unraid script to automate the full plexdance

:three: `process-tcards.cmd` - Windows script to create properly sized PLEX titlecards to use with TCM or for other purposes

:four: `pumpanddump.sh` - Unraid script to automate the plex db repair when using hotio plex container

:five: `chk-video-codec.sh` - Unraid script to find and sort files that have been converted to HEVC/H265 and those that have not been

:six: `create_poster.ps1` - Powershell script to create posters/images for PMM/PLEX/EMBY/JELLYFIN/OTHER

:seven: `advanced-plex-edits.py` - Sets your plex collections to default and then to hide in case your PMM separator blank collections continue to show

:eight: `get_missing_people.ps1` - Scans your PMM meta* logs to find missing people posters to download and create the bw, rainier, orig, etc. style poster for PMM/PLEX/EMBY/JELLYFIN/OTHER

:nine: `image_check.ps1` - Scans your transparent images for anomalies like head-chops, backgrounds not removed, and black and white photos instead of a color photo to give you a report so you can go and fix those by uploading new and better options to https://www.themoviedb.org/

:one::zero: `create_people_poster.ps1` - Scans your PMM meta* logs to find missing people posters and will download and create the bw, rainier, orig, transparent. style poster for PMM/PLEX/EMBY/JELLYFIN/OTHER. This script was put together by using the image_check, get_missing_people, and Power Automate Desktop Flow (remove background) all into 1

:one::one: `PAD Flows` - Various PAD flows for RPA stuff for PLEX, PMM, Other
    `a`  Convert Error: No TMDb ID Found for IMDb ID:","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"bullmoose20 GitHub Repo","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"Need some cool scripts? Check out chazlarson's repo at: https://github.com/chazlarson/Media-Scripts 

**Plex scripts**:
:one: `user-emails.py` - extract user emails from your shares
:two: `reset-posters-tmdb.py` - reset all artwork in a library to TMDB default
:three: `reset-posters-plex.py` - reset all artwork in a library to Plex default
:four: `grab-current-posters.py` - Grab currently-set posters and optionally background artwork
:five: `grab-all-posters.py` - grab some or all of the artwork for a library from plex
:six: `grab-all-status.py` - grab watch status for all users all libraries from plex
:seven: `apply-all-status.py` - apply watch status for all users all libraries to plex from the file emitted by the previous script
:eight: `show-all-playlists.py` - Show contents of all user playlists
:nine: `delete-collections.py` - delete most or all collections from one or more libraries
:keycap_ten: `refresh-metadata.py` - Refresh metadata individually on items in a library

**Plex-Meta Manager scripts**
:one: `extract_collections.py` - extract collections from a library
:two: `pmm_trakt_auth.py` - generate trakt auth block for PMM config.yml
:three: `pmm_mal_auth.py` - generate mal auth block for PMM config.yml

**TMDB scripts**
:one: `tmdb-people.py` - retrieve TMDB images for a list of people

***It's only typing...*** :tm: chazlarson","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Chazlarson GitHub Repo","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"Please use code blocks when sending any code-related text (such as error messages or configuration file extracts.)

The Grave Accent key (`` ` ``) is used to define code blocks and is typically found to the left of the number `1` key on a standard keyboard.

If you are posting any yaml-formatted text (such as collections), you can add `yaml` to your Grave Accent keys for coloured formatting. See the below sample text and output

**YOU TYPE THIS**
```
`​`​`yaml
collections:
  Documentaries:
    smart_filter:
      all:
        genre: Documentary
`​`​`
```

**DISCORD DISPLAYS**
```yaml
collections:
  Documentaries:
    smart_filter:
      all:
        genre: Documentary
```","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Using Code Blocks","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"You have been asked to provide your config file, which will allow us to support you further. 

Please **DO NOT** share your config.yml file as is without redacting it. It contains information that you do not want the public to have, nor do we need it to troubleshoot your scenario in MOST cases.

We will use a regex parser to redact the file for you.

:one: Goto https://regex101.com/r/DMo1DQ/latest 
:two: Copy the contents of your config.yml to the **TEST STRING** box in that page
:three: The results will be immediate and found in the **SUBSTITUTION** box below
:four: From the **SUBSTITUTION** box, select all, then copy and paste the redacted text into the channel where you want to share your config. (You will see `(redacted)` where confidential information was replaced)

Consider using Discord code blocks when sharing small parts of your config file. Check out `!code` for more info on code blocks","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Providing a redacted config.yml file","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"```
Convert Error: No TVDb ID Found for TMDb ID: 15733
Convert Error: No TMDb ID Found for IMDb ID: tt14431252
```
These sorts of errors indicate that the thing can't be cross-referenced between sites.  For example, at the time of that error, the TMDB record for "The Two Mrs. Grenvilles" [ID 15733] didn't contain a TVDB ID.  This could be because the record just hasn't been updated, or because "The Two Mrs. Grenvilles" isn't listed on TVDB. 

The fix is for someone [like you, perhaps] to go to the relevant site and fill in the missing data.
","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Convert Errors in your meta.log?","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"Plex Meta Manager provides a set of pre-made Metadata and Overlay files, allowing you to get the most commonly-used collections and overlays without having to manually set them up yourself.

You can learn more about them [here](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/home/guides/defaults.html) 
basically:
```
libraries:
  Movies:
    metadata_path:
    - pmm: actor
    - pmm: genre
    overlay_path:
    - remove_overlays: false
    - pmm: ribbon
    - pmm: ratings
```
and so on.

They offer a degree of customization.  That customization mechanism is described at the link.

If you ALSO want to use your local `My-Movies.yml`,  you can add it to the config like this:

```
libraries:
  Movies:
    metadata_path:
    - file: config/My-Movies.yml
    - pmm: actor
    - pmm: genre
    overlay_path:
    - remove_overlays: false
    - pmm: ribbon
    - pmm: ratings
```
It should be noted that users running the on [nightly branch](https://metamanager.wiki/en/nightly/home/kb.html#how-do-i-switch-to-the-nightly-branch) of Plex Meta Manager will receive all updates to the PMM Defaults as soon as they are published via [GitHub](https://github.com/meisnate12/Plex-Meta-Manager-Configs/tree/master/PMM), which may at times involve bugs or implementations that need to be further addressed. Users of the [develop](https://metamanager.wiki/en/nightly/home/kb.html#how-do-i-switch-to-the-develop-branch) and [master](https://metamanager.wiki/en/nightly/home/kb.html#how-do-i-switch-back-to-the-master-branch) branches will only receive updated Defaults files when an update to Plex Meta Manager is released - this helps to keep these branches stable and prevent bugs from reaching the wider user-base.","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"PMM Defaults","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"There are multiple ways to delete collections using PMM.

:one: `--delete-collections` [Run Command](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/home/environmental.html#delete-collections) will delete **ALL** Collections in that library at the beginning of the run.

:two: `delete_unmanaged_collections` [Library Operation](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/config/operations.html) at the end of the run will delete all collections that do not have the "PMM" label.

:three: `delete_not_scheduled` [Setting Detail](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/config/settings.html#delete-not-scheduled) will delete a collection that has a schedule defined and is not scheduled to run on this run.

:four: `delete_below_minimum` [Setting Detail](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/config/settings.html#delete-below-minimum) will delete any collection that no longer meets the minimum requirement.","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Deleting Collections","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"We highly recommend to use a decent editor software to manage PMM's .yml files.

Standard text editors (such as Notepad and TextEdit) often save text in a rich-text format which can result in text formatted in a way that PMM cannot read. But not only that, they also make it very hard to visually distinguish the formatting, such as indentation.
PMM requires indents to always be multiples of 2 spaces, and not TAB stops. If you have one space too much, or too few, it is very hard to notice that with a editor like Notepad.
An editor that is more focused on editing code instead of text will automatically detect the .YML fileformat and adjust things to make it easier to work. They can also try to detect possible errors even before you actually run the .yml in PMM.

This can save a lot of time and headaches.

**Visual Studio Code** (Windows/Mac/Linux, Opensource & Free)
[Website](https://code.visualstudio.com) 

**Notepad++** (Windows only, Opensource & Free)
[Website](https://notepad-plus-plus.org) 

**Sublime Text** (Windows/Mac/Linux, Paid)
[Website](https://www.sublimetext.com)

For further details and a short list of highly recommended extensions, you can also take a look [here](https://l33tlamer.github.io/yml-tips/). ","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Recommended Text Editors","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/b1kMJWZ/ede5d53260e23960e23153b12c36612519c0db73a6308180ef82b2a1e3273cc5.png"},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"A 500 Internal Server Error happens when the server has an unexpected error when responding to an API request.

There could be any number of reasons why this happens and it depends on what server PMM is talking to although its most likely coming from your Plex Server.

Most of the time these errors need to be resolved by changing something specific to your set up but some do come up that can be fixed (i.e. Plex throws one if you upload a photo larger then 10 MB)

Many Appbox Setups will throw this error when too many requests are sent","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"500 Internal Server Error","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[{"name":"Take a look at the following logs:","value":":one: Settings | Manage | Console -> then filter on Error and Warning to see what might be going on
:two: Check the plex logs (container or other)  for the "Busy DB Sleeping for 200ms)","inline":false}]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"The Linuxserver.io image [`linuxserver/plex-meta-manager`] Is different to the official image [`meisnate12/plex-meta-manager`] in a few ways that cause problems.



The LSIO image only has `latest`, no `develop` or `nightly`.  If you want to switch to develop or nightly to try a new feature, you can't with LSIO image.

It keeps the PMM files in a different place inside the image compared to official, so when you exec into it you can't just run PMM, you need to cd into another dir first.


It also resets ownership of the entire config dir every run.  In tests, the ownership of the config dir and its contents was set to 911:911 with each run.  The official image runs as root by default, and will set the ownership of the files it creates during that run to `root` if you don't specify a user, but lsio appears to reset the entire config tree rather than just a log file or two with every run.

Generally speaking, we suggest you use the official image instead of lsio. type `!repo` for more info
","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"LinuxServer (LSIO) Issues","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"When PMM applies an overlay, it attaches an `Overlay` label to the item so that it knows what has an Overlay and what does not. If you [or plex] changes the image, then PMM has no way of knowing this. The easiest way to force overlays to apply to a "new" image is to remove the Overlay label either before or after you chage the image.

Unfortunately, Plex does not display the labels attached to Seasons or Episodes, so we have to use collections to force a remove of these labels (we make sure the collection isn't actually built).","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Understanding the Overlay label","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[{"name":"Removing Season Overlay Label","value":"```yml
collections:
  Remove Overlay Labels:
    build_collection: false
    builder_level: season
    item_label.remove: Overlay
    plex_search:
      all:
        season_label: Overlay
        title:  NAME OF SHOW HERE
```","inline":false},{"name":"Removing Episode Overlay Label","value":"```yml
collections:
  Remove Overlay Labels:
    build_collection: false
    builder_level: episode
    item_label.remove: Overlay
    plex_search:
      all:
        episode_label: Overlay
        title:  NAME OF SHOW HERE
```","inline":false}]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"
The purpose of this is to remove all cached metadata and xml data for an item that Plex usually keeps. This helps when you want to “start from scratch” for particular items.


**Before** doing the plex dance, it is strongly recommended to stop prowlarr, tdarr, lidarr, sonarr, and radarr.


:one: Move the folders/files for the media to a location not scanned by Plex.
:two: Click the three dots next to the server name, or library name for just one library, on the left sidebar and click the "Scan Library Files".
:three: Click the same three dots > "Manage Library" > "Empty Trash".
:four: If applicable, click "More > " at the bottom of the sidebar and click the three dots next to the server name > "Manage Server" > "Clean Bundles".
:five: Move the folders/files back to your media folder.
:six: Click the three dots on the server or library and click the "Scan Library Files" again.


Once finished all of your plex dancing, it is recommended to:
**Optimize DB**


**NOTE** When performing a full library plex dance, create a "fakedir" in the folder with 0 media in it. At the end of the plex dance, you can remove those "fakedir" directories.


If you stopped tdarr, sonarr, radarr, lidarr, and prowlarr before starting the plex dance, you can restart them now.
","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Plex Dance","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":"https://media.tenor.com/LuXiI6SjxLkAAAAC/linus-floss.gif"},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"Having trouble with PLEX? Here are some links that may help you.

Description: Upgrading configuration files for 1.18 and beyond
Response:
{"embed":{"title":"","description":"To transition from pre-1.18.0 versions to 1.18.0, you **must** do the following, or you will see errors in your log and previously working overlays will no longer be applied.

","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Upgrading PMM Defaults to 1.18.0","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[{"name":"**Upgrading to the `ribbon` PMM Default file** ","value":"**1)** Remove any reference to these files in your config.yml:
```yaml
- git: PMM/overlays/oscars
- git: PMM/overlays/imdb_top_250
- git: PMM/overlays/rt_cert_fresh
- git: PMM/overlays/mc_must_see
- git: PMM/overlays/commonsense_selection
```
**2)** Add a reference to this file (only once!)
```yaml
- pmm: ribbon
```
As only one ribbon image can be placed at a time, the priority list is currently:
`oscars` (weight 40)
`imdb` (weight 30)
`rotten` (Weight 20)
`metacritic` (Weight 10)
`common` (Weight 5)

To alter these positions,you can use template variables, like so:
```yaml
- pmm: ribbon
  template_variables:
    weight_common: 100 #Makes it first on the list
    weight_imdb: 90 #Makes it second on the list
```","inline":false},{"name":"**Upgrading to the `resolution` PMM Default file** ","value":"**1)** Remove any reference to these files in your config.yml:
```yaml
- git: PMM/overlays/special_release
- git: PMM/resolution_standards
```","inline":false},{"name":"**Upgrading from `audio_language` to the `language_count` PMM Default file** ","value":"**1)** Remove any reference to these files in your config.yml:
```yaml
- git: PMM/overlays/audio_language
```
**2)** Add a reference to this file
```yaml
- pmm: language_count
```","inline":false}]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"Plex has three available "slots" for ratings: `critic`, `audience` and `user`.

PMM has the ability to override the values in these slots, meaning you can control where the ratings are actually coming from, one example is:
```yml
libraries:
  Movies:
    operations:
      mass_audience_rating_update: omdb
      mass_critic_rating_update: mdb_tomatoes
      mass_user_rating_update: mdb_trakt
```
A full list of available options can be found [here](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/config/operations.html#mass-rating-update).

We cannot replace the "TMDB" or Rotten Tomatoes icons that appear in the Plex UI, so we recommend using the `- pmm: ratings` [PMM Defaults file](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/defaults/overlays/ratings.html) to place the ratings on the poster of the media instead.
","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Understanding Ratings","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"You're seen an error which includes one or both of:
```
socket.timeout: timed out
```
or
```
Unknown Error: HTTPConnectionPool(host='SOME_IP, port=SOME_PORT): Max retries exceeded with url: SOME_URL
```
Typically this is your Plex server timing out when PMM tries to connect to it.  There's nothing PMM can do about this directly.  You can try increasing the connection timeout in `config.yml`:
```
plex:
  url: http://bing.bang.boing 
  token: REDACTED
  timeout: 360   <<< right here
```
But that's not a guarantee.

Effectively what's happening here is that you're ringing the doorbell and no one's answering.  You can't do anything about that aside from waiting longer.  You can't ring the doorbell differently.

This seems to happen most often in an Appbox context, so perhaps contact your appbox provider to discuss it.
","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Timeout Error","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Plex Tokens","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[{"name":"Finding Your Token","value":"1. Sign in to your server using the server owner's credentials

2. Browse to a library item and [view the XML](https://support.plex.tv/articles/201998867-investigate-media-information-and-formats/) for it

3. Look in the URL and find the token as the X-Plex-Token value (typically at the very end of the URL, it may contain a `-` or `_` character, this is fine)

","inline":false},{"name":"Getting a New Token","value":"In rare cases, you may find yourself wanting to invalidate an existing token so it no longer works and get a new one. This isn’t something most users will ever need to do.

The easiest way to do so is to go to your [Plex account profile](https://app.plex.tv/desktop#!/settings/account), choose to change your password, and check the Sign out connected devices after password change option when entering the new password.

This will invalidate all of your tokens and, as the setting name states, sign all of your apps (and any Plex Media Servers) out of your account. When you then sign back in, you’ll re-authenticate and get a new token.","inline":false}]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"We require more low-level logs from your PMM run in order to be able to assist your further; we call these "trace logs" and they give us a more in-depth look at what is happening behind-the-scenes when PMM is running.


in order to get trace logs, you need to run PMM again using the `--trace` [environment variable](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/home/environmental.html#trace ).


Once you have completed your run with Trace enabled, you can find your `meta.log` file within the `logs` folder of your Plex Meta Manager config folder [typically where you would find your config.yml]



Drag-and-drop your meta.log file directly into the Discord support thread. If the file is larger than 50mb, we suggest zipping it or uploading it to another file-sharing website.

Please DO NOT manually extract, copy and paste text from your log files directly into Discord as the formatting can be difficult to read and can often redact parts of the log file that are important for full context.
","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Providing TRACE level Log Files","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":"https://media.tenor.com/4D3DhzVOu-oAAAAM/press-any-key-any-key.gif"},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"When using third-party services such as Sonarr or Radarr to manage media, we recommend following the TRaSH Guides Recommended Naming Scheme guide to ensure compatibility when using the PMM Default Overlay files.

Without using these naming schemes, we cannot guarantee that the default PMM overlays will work with your library.

Further information can be found on the TRaSH Guides website: 
- [Radarr Recommended Naming Scheme](https://trash-guides.info/Radarr/Radarr-recommended-naming-scheme/ )
- [Sonarr Recommended Naming Scheme](https://trash-guides.info/Sonarr/Sonarr-recommended-naming-scheme/ )","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"TRaSH Guides Naming Scheme","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"NOTE: This is addressing UPDATING your current setup, not changing from, for instance, `latest` to `nightly`.

The update method depends on how you installed it.

**I'm running locally and got the code by downloading the zip file:**
Download a new zip file, uncompress it, and move your config dir into that new directory.  Reinstall requirements.

This is the "fussiest" method of update.

**I'm running locally and retrieved the code via git:**
```
cd DIRECTORY_WHERE_YOU_PUT_PMM
git checkout BRANCH_NAME
git stash
git stash clear
git pull
```
For BRANCH_NAME, substitute `master`, `develop`, or `nightly`

You may need to reinstall requirements if switching branch or updating to a new major version:
`python -m pip install -r requirements.txt
`

Those `stash` commands are going to discard any changes you may have made to PMM's own files.  If that's a concern, you are probably familiar enough with `git` to know what you need to do instead.

**I'm using docker locally:**
```
docker pull meisnate12/plex-meta-manager:TAG_HERE
```
replace `TAG_HERE` with `latest`, `develop`, or `nightly`

Then recreate your container via whatever means you used to create it  [`docker run`, `docker-compose`, etc.].

**I'm using docker on a NAS or some other remote context:**

Update the image using whatever means the NAS provides.
Depending on the system, this might be a simple rebuild of the container, or you may need to manually pull the new image first.","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Updating PMM","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"The PMM Default Metadata and Overlay files utilize what is known as template variables.
These variables let you to override what is set by default within the PMM files, giving you the flexibility of editing the collections/overlays without having to edit the behind-the-scenes configurations.


The below template variable pins the "TMDb Top Rated" collection from the `- pmm: tmdb` file to your homescreen in Plex:
```yaml
libraries:
  Movies:
    metadata_path:
      - pmm: tmdb
        template_variables:
          visible_home_top: true
```


A full list of the Shared Variables (i.e. variables that are universal across almost all Defaults) can be found [here](https://metamanager.wiki/en/nightly/defaults/variables.html). 

The wiki also has a page for each Default file which specifies any unique variables specific to that file, and also specifies any keys which need to be used to control aspects of each collection (such as `top` being the key for "TMDb Top Rated" as can be seen [here](https://metamanager.wiki/en/nightly/defaults/chart/tmdb.html#collections-section-01)). 
","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Using Template Variables","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"Have you gone through the wiki before asking your question? Please use the correct link for the branch that you're running, as each branch's wiki has information that may not yet be available in other branches.


You can find access to the Plex Meta Manager Wiki for each branch at the following links:


- [Master/Latest Branch](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/) 
- [Develop Branch](https://metamanager.wiki/en/develop/) 
- [Nightly Branch](https://metamanager.wiki/en/nightly/) 


**Search**


Having trouble finding things in the wiki? Use the search and see what you can find: 


- [Master/Latest Branch Search](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/search.html) 
- [Develop Branch Search](https://metamanager.wiki/en/develop/search.html) 
- [Nightly Branch Search](https://metamanager.wiki/en/nightly/search.html) 


**Knowledgebase/FAQ**


Want to perform your own support before using the community driven and free support here on Discord? This is where you can go through some basic steps to understand what might be failing and how you can fix the issue yourself.


- [Master/Latest Branch Search](https://metamanager.wiki/en/latest/home/kb.html) 
- [Develop Branch Search](https://metamanager.wiki/en/develop/home/kb.html) 
- [Nightly Branch Search](https://metamanager.wiki/en/nightly/home/kb.html)

{"embed":{"title":"","description":"Most of the common issues with Metadata files is that they have common validation issues (such as incorrect indentation, missed colons `:` or commas `,`.)


The easiest way to check for this is to copy and past the text from your `<filename>.yml` file into a YML Validator such as:
- http://www.yamllint.com/ 
- https://codebeautify.org/yaml-validator 


Once you have pasted your file, you should get a message similar to "Valid YAML". If you do not get this message, it indicates that something is structured incorrectly within your file and requires further investigation.


Please send or screenshot the result of your YAML validation so that we can support you further.","color":4321431,"timestamp":"2022-07-08T17:42:44.881Z","url":"https://discord.com","author":{"name":"Validating YAML Files","url":"https://discord.com","icon_url":""},"thumbnail":{"url":"https://i.ibb.co/XLBh3D5/Logo.png"},"image":{"url":""},"footer":{"text":"Thanks for using Plex Meta Manager!","icon_url":"https://i.ibb.co/0J6pDzH/pmmheart.png"},"fields":[]}}
